value.title: AI researchers say we’ve squeezed nearly as much out of modern computers as we can

value.title: Federal agencies concerned face masks will thwart facial recognition tech
value.excerpt: The US Department of Homeland Security has raised concerns internally that face masks meant to protect against the spread of COVID-19 may interfere with facial recognition technology, The Intercept reported.

value.title: Google's Fabricius uses machine learning to decode hieroglyphs
value.excerpt: Google’s Arts and Culture vertical has been known to release fun apps and tools to help people engage with art and history. Now, the company is launching a web-based AI tool to let users interact with ancient Egyptian hieroglyphs and also help researchers decode the symbols with machine learning.

value.title: Amazon: AI can’t solve every conversational problem

value.title: Japanese robot to clock in at a convenience store in test of retail automation
value.excerpt: In August, a robot vaguely resembling a kangaroo will begin stacking sandwiches, drinks and ready meals on shelves at a Japanese convenience store in a test its maker, Telexistence, hopes will help trigger a wave of retail automation.
